task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 59°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: Failed to parse response, using fallback.
I can’t estimate the building height without actually seeing the façade/roof in the image, so I should look up to capture the top of the structure.
My heading shifted to 0° so I should rotate right about 59° to re-center the target building while keeping the upward pitch to see its top.
I’m correctly re-aimed at ~59° but need the roofline in view to estimate height, so I should tilt up.
The system keeps snapping me to 0° when pitching up, so I should rotate right ~59° again while staying pitched up to keep the building in frame.
Rather than pitch up (which resets heading), I should move closer to the building so more of it fills the frame for a height estimate.
I need to reorient to the target at ~59°NE from my current ~352° heading by rotating right about 67°.
Now that I'm roughly aimed at the building, I should tilt up to capture the roofline for height estimation.
Pitching up reset me to 0° again, so I should rotate right to ~67° to get the building back in view while staying pitched up.
To estimate height without losing heading, I’ll keep pitch level and move closer again so the building’s vertical extent is clearer in-frame.
After moving, I'm again facing ~352° so I should rotate right about 75° to re-center the NE building.
I’m oriented toward the target sector and should now provide the height estimate of the main building visible ahead based on its apparent ~3–4 storeys.
